name: NSAppleScript
desc: An object that provides the ability to load, compile, and execute scripts.

items.name: init?(contentsOf: URL, error: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<NSDictionary?>?)
items.desc: Initializes a newly allocated script instance from the source identified by the passed URL.

items.name: init?(source: String)
items.desc: Initializes a newly allocated script instance from the passed source.

items.name: var isCompiled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver's script has been compiled.

items.name: var source: String?
items.desc: The script source for the receiver.

items.name: func compileAndReturnError(AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<NSDictionary?>?) -> Bool
items.desc: Compiles the receiver, if it is not already compiled.

items.name: func executeAndReturnError(AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<NSDictionary?>?) -> NSAppleEventDescriptor
items.desc: Executes the receiver, compiling it first if it is not already compiled.

items.name: func executeAppleEvent(NSAppleEventDescriptor, error: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<NSDictionary?>?) -> NSAppleEventDescriptor
items.desc: Executes an Apple event in the context of the receiver, as a means of allowing the application to invoke a handler in the script.
